title: CNC/CAM Programmer
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Your role and your team:
As we head towards the start of production of our groundbreaking Lilium jet, we are looking for an experienced CNC/CAM Programmer to join our team, getting hands-on in the jet's manufacture!
In this position, you will work on a variety of projects and tasks.   Programming and operating state-of-the-art 5ax CNC-Machines (GROB, MAZAK). Using HyperMill, Siemens 840D and Mazatrol Smooth-X as well as assisting the engineering teams by providing feedback for design improvements.
Your Day to Day:

Programming of components in HyperMill CAM and on the machine (Siemens 840D, Mazatrol SmoothX)
Independent control of components with modern measuring equipment (dimensions and tolerances)
Assistance in the continuous process optimization of workflows, optimize the life and use of cutting tools.
Assist the Manufacturing Lab team in the development of tooling and new equipment commissioning and implementation.
Work cross-functionally with related departments

e.g., work with Manufacturing Engineering to improve processes, equipment & tooling, and machining efficiency.
e.g., improve manufacturing standards and process requirements.
e.g., support digital improvements and innovations while working with manufacturing execution systems.



Your Profile: 
We are looking for a hard working team player who can join our fast growing team.  We look for people who are happy in an environment where each day is different. where you learn and adapt to change constantly.
You should enjoy working autonomously and be a good communicator who can interact with a wide variety of colleagues and teams.   Ideally you will have background as a cutting machine operator, CNC Programmer, CNC Technician etc and have developed into CAM programming .  and around 5 years’ experience in CNC job setup.
Your skills should include: 

Experience with a CAM system, developing end-to-end processes. 
Experience in HyperMill is beneficial.
Able to read and understand manufacturing instructions setup sheets.
Experience with operating and maintaining a wide variety of hand and power tools, shop tools, test equipment. Experience operating high volume production machinery preferred
Minimum of 2 years’ experience with 5 axis Machining center required
Experience in Conversational Programming (Siemens 840D and/or Mazatrol SmoothX)
Fluent English required; German language is a plus.

#LI-CG1
 Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

questions.description:
Lilium Website Privacy Notice

Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice

** For clarity, to comply with our legal obligations, Lilium will collect, store, and process your data for 6 months for the purpose of considering you for employment.  Additionally, should you provide consent directly below, Lilium will also collect, store, and process your data for up to 730 days thereafter for the purpose of considering you for other opportunities on the Lilium Career Portal.
questions.label: Data Protection Information

values.label: I confirm that I have read and understood the Lilium Website Privacy Notice and the Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice, regarding the collection, processing and storage of my personal data for the recruitment process.

questions.label: IMPORTANT: I confirm I have submitted my CV in English, and understand that my application will not be reviewed if it is in another language
